etymology.description: 𡿧 (disaster; floods) + 日(日) (rì, "sun") -> the flood submerging the sun -> represents the past
etymology.interpretation: The character 昔(xī, "past") symbolizes a time when disaster, like a flood, obscures the sun, metaphorically referring to past times shrouded by events.

examples.chinese: 他常怀念昔日的美好(他常懷念昔日的美好)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cháng huái niàn xī rì de měi hǎo.
examples.english: He often cherishes the beautiful past.

examples.chinese: 那古城见证了昔时光(那古城見證了昔時光)，铺陈了历史的痕迹(鋪陳了歷史的痕跡)。
examples.pinyin: Nà gǔ chéng jiàn zhèng le xī shí guāng, pù chén le lì shǐ de hén jì.
examples.english: That ancient city witnessed the bygone days and displayed the marks of history.
